title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge ruled Massachusetts Cannabis Control Commission Chair Shannon O'Brien must be reinstated, but the state filed an appeal.
Suffolk Superior Court stayed the ruling to reinstate O'Brien pending an appeal by State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg.
O'Brien's suspension in 2023 followed accusations of misconduct; her term ends August 31, 2027.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A 38-year-old woman was found dead on Newhall Street in Lynn early Sunday morning.
A 30-year-old Lynn man was arrested and charged with murder in connection with the woman's death.
The suspect is set to be arraigned in Lynn District Court on Monday morning; names have not been released.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers denied a trade request from the Las Vegas Raiders but emphasizes he's content with the team.
Meyers made eight catches for 97 yards against the Patriots, feeling his return to Gillette Stadium was a homecoming.
Raiders began 2025 under new coach Pete Carroll and quarterback Geno Smith after consecutive poor seasons.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A tornado was confirmed in Holden, Massachusetts, near Worcester, during Saturday's storm, per the National Weather Service.
Crews responded to electrical line damage and fallen trees in Paxton and Holyoke, affecting homes and power services.
Severe thunderstorm and tornado watches extended across Massachusetts, with no injuries reported despite multiple road blockages.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots lost 20-13 to the Raiders in the 2025 season opener under new coach Mike Vrabel.
Quarterback Drake Maye completed 14 of 20 passes for 150 yards and a touchdown in the first half.
New defensive additions showed promise, but Las Vegas QB Geno Smith totaled 362 passing yards.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie left-tackle Will Campbell showed promise before late game errors in Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Campbell was responsible for two sacks and two false start penalties, acknowledging his need to improve.
Mike Vrabel and Maxx Crosby noted Campbell's potential, with Crosby praising his talent and future prospects.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer is on leave following a video showing him incapacitated during a traffic stop.
The officer's condition is being investigated as a potential medical episode, according to the department.
The video shows the officer unresponsive and stumbling, leading to public concerns addressed by Lynn police.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost 20-13 to the Raiders in their season opener under new coach Mike Vrabel.
Harold Landry III excelled with 2.5 sacks, significantly impacting the Raiders' backfield.
Rookie TreVeyon Henderson led the Patriots' struggling run game with 27 yards on five carries.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys performed at Suffolk Downs after a two-hour rain delay impacted the Seisiún festival.
The concert included a tribute to late Pogues frontman Shane McGowan, featuring a heartfelt setlist.
Heavy rain caused initial confusion, but the Murphys energized a reduced, dedicated audience.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices due to feeling unwelcome at their facility.
Belichick cited a fractured relationship with the Patriots after leaving the team following the 2023 season.
UNC notified Patriots of the scout ban a day before a scheduled visit, confirming strained ties between Belichick and his former team.
